availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Colins (Grant County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Reuben Collins. Married to Sarah Ann Cooker Collins in Grant County, Kentucky on July 25, 1839. Father of Mary F. Collins, Fountain Collins, Elizabeth J. Collins, James K.P. Collins, Sophia Collins, Angeline Collins, Jackson Collins, William G. Collins, and Marium T. Collins. Farmer in Grant County in 1850. Farmer in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 321B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 887.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Grant County Marriages, Film #001490815, p. 15.
